result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyler A. Marco

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tyler A. Marco in court with attorney Andrew M. Morgan.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 15CM145 & 15CM259  @ 1:34 pm.  State gives plea agreement, 15CM145 DRI, 15CM259 plea to ct's 1 & 3, ct's 2 & 4 DRI, withheld sentence 1 year probation,  no threatening or  violent  contact with A.D, counseling & 100 fine plus costs, DNA Sample & surcharge, Victim rights have been complied. Atty Morgan & def. agree with plea agreement. Plea questionnaire and waiver of rights filed. Def. understands charge & penalties.  Ct 1 Knowingly Violate Order,  no contest plea, Ct 3 Bailjumping, no contest plea.  Ct's 2 & DRI. 15CM145 DRI.  Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T. rights.  Def. understands elements.  Atty Morgan is satisfied. Court finds pleas are freely & voluntarily given.  Factual basis stipulated.  Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and finds def. Guilty to Knowingly Violate Order, in ct 1 & Bailjumping in ct 3. State gives sentencing recommendation. Atty Morgan gives sentencing recommendation.  Def. has  nothing to say.  Court orders on ct 1 
withheld jail sentence 1 year probation, 100 fine plus costs, DNA sample and $200 surcharge, No threatening or  violent  contact with A.D. counseling deemed by agent.
ct 3 withheld sentence 1 year probation, concurrent, court costs, $200 DNA surcharge, Credit for 2 days if revoked. Bond applied to fine & costs. 
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Def. advised of postconviction rights.

Final pre-trial on May 23, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Jury trial on June 8, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on May 23, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Tyler A. Marco not in court.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 11:35 am.  Court calling to adjourn jury trial.  State gives reason why requesting an adjournment. Atty Morgan not objecting to adjournment.  State has received transcript in the mail today for retired court reporter.  Court has tried to contact Atty Morgan but got voicemail.  Court will grant adjournment.  COC to cancel jurors.  Status conference scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Tyler A. Marco
Current: 1133 Lincoln Street Apt #118, Antigo, WI 54409 United States  (Effective: 12-03-2015)
Prior: 1333 Lincoln Street Apt #118, Antigo, WI 54409 United States

Defendant Tyler A. Marco in court with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint received, reviewed and waive reading.  Not guilty plea entered.  No objection to bond continue.  Court will received not guilty pleas.  Bond will continue  Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
